intro: Pentzia calva, commonly known as the white-flowered restia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in dunes and rocky areas. Pentzia calva is adapted to saline and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
